isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - DISASSEMBLE - SHIFTER HOUSING

step1.para: Tilt the assembly and remove the three sets of tension springs and balls from the housing bores ( Figure 98).

figure.caption: Figure 98. Remove Tension Springs and Balls From Housing Bores

step1.para: Secure the assembly in a vise with the plunger-side up ( Figure 99). (The front of the housing will be to the left.) For models so equipped, cut the lockwire and turn out the retaining bolts to remove the oil trough from the housing.

note.para: Start with the upper shift bar and move all bars to the right and out the rear boss bore. Cut the lockwire and remove the bolts from each bar just before their removal.

step1.para: Move the 4th-5th speed yoke bar to the shifter housing rear and remove the shift yoke and shift block from the yoke bar ( Figure 100).

figure.caption: Figure 100. Remove Shift Yoke and Shift Block From Yoke Bar

step1.para: Move the 2nd-3rd speed yoke bar to the housing rear, removing the yoke and block from the bar. As the neutral notch in the bar clears the rear boss, remove the small interlock pin from the notch bore ( Figure 101).

figure.caption: Figure 101. Remove Interlock Pin From Notch Bore

step1.para: Remove the actuating plunger from the center boss bore ( Figure 102).

figure.caption: Figure 102. Remove Actuating Plunger From Center Boss Bore

step1.para: Move the short 1st-Reverse speed yoke bar to the housing rear and remove the yoke from the bar. As the yoke bar is removed from the housing, two 3/4 inch interlock balls will drop from the rear boss bottom bore ( Figure 103).
If necessary, remove the plug, spring, and reverse-stop plunger from the 1st-Reverse speed shift yoke bore ( Figure 104).

figure.caption: Figure 104. Remove Plug, Spring, and Reverse-Stop Plunger
